column4: hello everybody :) .... how can i set up virtual name based hosting with dhcp and wireless?
i develop sites on my laptop and would like the customer to view the site ahead of time while i'm on the phone with them
i have lamp server set up and a registered name but i connect to the Internet thru dhcp
i use dynamic service too but i can't assign my nic a ip address
cuse it  isn't my isp service.... it's public
yes CarlFK  but i wouldn't be on the phone with the customer if i had them where they could see when i did http://localhost
i live on a boat... unfortunately having a home network is impossible for me right now
You could send the site ( especially if it's static ) to someone who does have a publicly accessible server, or the customer ( though I am guessing they wouldn't know what to do with it )
i have a server set up at my mom's but didn't want to develop, transfer, develop, transfer...etc.
You could foreward traffic from your mom'
... From your mom's server to yours over ssh ( a session initiated on your end ) but it would probably not be worth the trouble
thnx but that is already set up
If that is already setup then why can't the customer access your server through the one at your mom's ?
I was trying to shorten the process for the customer

I am not sure that you understand what I mean, ssh has some fancy tricks and you can foreward packets from port 80 on the server at your mom's over an ssh tunnel to your machine, even without having a publicly accessible ip on your machine.
